text:
July 24, 1956
Mrs, Robert E. KcKann
117 Lighthouse Drive, Route 3
Hampton, Virginia
Dear Mrs. McKann:
Your request of July 17 for information about our distribution of tape re¬
corded radio programs through our NAEB Radio Network has been received.
Unfortunately, these programs are made available only to education stations
belonging to the NAEB, I have therefore set forth below some information
about membership in the Association,
The NAEB has three categories of membership, as follows:
Active - Educational institutions, public service organizations, etc,
owning and operating their own radio and/or television stations.
Associate - Institutions (as above) not owning stations, but operating
production centers and regularly producing programs over a
commercial outlet.
Affiliate - Any organization or individual interested in the general
furtherance of educational broadcasting.
For .ctive members with radio stations, dues in the association are based on
rated transmitter power, as follows:
Class A - 5 kw and over - $50,00
Class B - 1 - 4.9 kw - 25.00
Class G - less than 1 kw - 15.00
Television stations with less than 5 kw video power pay ^50.00 and those
with 5 kw or more video power pay $100,00.
Associate and Affiliate members pay $10.00 a year. For this fee members re¬
ceive our monthly Newsletter: the various reports and surveys we publish
periodically; services of our Placement Service, television engineer, legal
counsel, management consultant, etc.; plus the normal day to day services, in¬
formation, and advice than any national organization gives its members.
